meanings.definition: Moving quickly or with great haste
meanings.sent1: The rushing wind felt cool on my face.
meanings.sent2: She was rushing to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The rushing river carried the boat downstream faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The rushing cars on the highway resembled a colorful blur.
meanings.sent5: The rushing waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The act of moving quickly or with great haste
meanings.sent1: His rushing through the crowd caused some chaos.
meanings.sent2: The rushing of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent3: The rushing of the students to the cafeteria made the teacher chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The rushing of the waves against the shore sounded like a distant drum.
meanings.sent5: The rushing of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds.

meanings.definition: A sudden surge or increase in activity or speed
meanings.sent1: The rushing of orders during lunchtime kept the kitchen busy.
meanings.sent2: The rushing of adrenaline before the race made her heart race.
meanings.sent3: The rushing of ideas in his mind led to a creative breakthrough.
meanings.sent4: The rushing of customers into the store signaled the start of a sale.
meanings.sent5: The rushing of time as the deadline approached was nerve-wracking.
